---
title: Building with AdCP
sidebarTitle: Overview
description: Complete guide to integrating and building with the Ad Context Protocol
---

This section provides everything you need to understand, integrate, and build robust systems with AdCP.

## Learning Path

<CardGroup cols={3}>
  <Card title="Understanding AdCP" icon="lightbulb" href="/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/understanding">
    Why AdCP exists, the problems it solves, and protocol comparison. Start here if you're new.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Foundations" icon="cubes" href="/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration">
    Technical building blocks: MCP or A2A protocols, capability discovery, authentication, and data models.
  </Card>
  <Card title="Implementation Patterns" icon="gears" href="/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation">
    Build production-ready systems with async operations, webhooks, error handling, and orchestrator patterns.
  </Card>
</CardGroup>

## Quick Start

**Already know which protocol you're using?**

- [MCP Integration Guide](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/mcp-guide) - For Claude, AI assistants, and MCP-compatible tools
- [A2A Integration Guide](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/a2a-guide) - For Google AI agents and A2A-compatible workflows

**Need to choose a protocol?**

See [Protocol Comparison](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/understanding/protocol-comparison) for a detailed comparison.

## Section Overview

### Understanding AdCP

Conceptual foundation for everyone working with AdCP:

- **[Why AdCP](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/understanding)** - The strategic vision: unifying buying paradigms and enabling AI surfaces
- **[Protocol Comparison](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/understanding/protocol-comparison)** - MCP vs A2A at a glance

### Foundations

Technical building blocks for any AdCP implementation:

- **[MCP Guide](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/mcp-guide)** - Tool calls, context, and examples
- **[A2A Guide](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/a2a-guide)** - Tasks, streaming, and artifacts
- **[Capability Discovery](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/protocol/get_adcp_capabilities)** - Discover what an agent supports
- **[Authentication](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/authentication)** - Credentials and permissions
- **[Context & Sessions](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/integration/context-sessions)** - Managing state across requests
- **[Schemas and SDKs](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/schemas-and-sdks)** - Access schemas and official client libraries

### Implementation Patterns

For building robust, production-ready systems:

- **[Task Lifecycle](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/task-lifecycle)** - Status values, transitions, and polling
- **[Async Operations](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/async-operations)** - Handling sync, async, and interactive tasks
- **[Webhooks](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/webhooks)** - Push notifications and reliability patterns
- **[Error Handling](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/error-handling)** - Error categories, codes, and recovery
- **[Security](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/security)** - Security considerations and best practices
- **[Orchestrator Design](/dist/docs/3.0.0-beta.3/building/implementation/orchestrator-design)** - State machines and system architecture
